summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 3, 2020, between a potential witness/victim and FBI officials regarding the Epstein investigation. The witness, who identifies as a rape victim from 20 years prior, is proactively reaching out to provide information and requests a secure interview, preferably via Zoom. FBI officials acknowledge the communication and arrange for the case agent to make contact.

events.title: Witness outreach to FBI
events.description: A potential witness/victim emails the FBI New York Field Office offering information related to a rape from 20 years ago that may connect to the Epstein investigation. FBI officials respond and arrange for contact from the case agent.

keyFacts: A potential witness/victim (referred to as 'W') contacted the FBI on July 3, 2020, claiming to have information about a rape from 20 years ago that may be relevant to the Epstein investigation.

The witness expressed a preference for a Zoom interview over a phone call for security reasons, citing a recent bad online experience and a history of living under provable online threat for over 20 years.

FBI officials, including an Assistant Director in Charge and a Special Agent in Charge from the New York Field Office, acknowledged the email and indicated that the Epstein investigation task force would follow up, initially via phone.
The witness mentioned waiting for Scotland Yard to find notes from over 20 years ago to seek justice and recompense, indicating a prior international aspect to their case.

The email chain highlights the FBI's ongoing investigation into Epstein and their protocol for handling sensitive witness communications, including security considerations around communication methods.
